text:
Same thing with me.
So in relation to your issue, what I did was I created an Airtable, push the data that passes through my custom code to Airtable, and see the number of records being created, and that should be similar to the number of enrolled records on the workflow. Or it would also depend on your workflow if there's some conditions or other things, but that's my solution to make sure all records are executed properly on the WF.

Hi all,
I have seen that Webhook subscriptions for custom object deletions are not yet supported.
And we are finding a way on how to listen from HubSpot side if there are custom object records being deleted, so that we can update our Member Portal app as well. What do you think is the best way using WF or Custom Coding for this type of use case? Thanks
